item.title: Heading
item.description: markdown # h1 Heading ## h2 Heading ### h3 Heading #### h4 Heading ##### h5 Heading ###### h6 Heading Or html <h1>h1 Heading</h1> <h2>h2 Heading</h2> <h3>h3 Heading</h3> <h4>h4 Heading</h4> <h5>h5 Heading</h5> <h6>h6 Heading</h6> Renders to: h1 Heading h2 Heading h3 Heading h4 Heading h5 Heading h6 Heading

item.title: Comment
item.description: <!-- This is a comment --> Comment below should NOT be seen Renders to:

item.title: Horizontal Rule
item.description: markdown ___: three consecutive underscores ---: three consecutive dashes ***: three consecutive asterisks or html <hr> renders to:

item.title: Body Copy
item.description: markdown I'm the body copy (๑´ㅂ`๑) or html <p> I'm the body copy (๑´ㅂ`๑) ~ </p> renders to: I’m the body copy (๑´ㅂ`๑) I'm the body copy (๑´ㅂ`๑)~

item.title: Emphasis
item.description: Bold Markdown: **bold text(´･ω･`)** HTML: <strong>bold text2 (´･ω･`)</strong> renders to: bold text1 (´･ω･`) bold text2 (´･ω･`) Italics Markdown _italicized text1_ html <em>italicized text2</em> renders to: italicized text1 italicized text2 strikethrough Markdown ~~the strikethrogh1~~ html <del>the strikethrogh2</del> renders to: the strikethrogh1 the strikethrogh2

item.title: Blockquote
item.description: markdown > Here is **Blockquote 1** html <blockquote> Here is <em> Blockquote 2 </em> </blockquote> renders to: Here is Blockquote 1 Here is Blockquote 2 Nested > 1(two tabs) > 2 > >> 3 > > 4(no tab) > 5 1 2 3 4 5

item.title: List
item.description: Unordered markdown + 1 - 2 ('+' or '-' doesn't matter) + 3 + 4 html <ul> <li>1</li> <ul> <li>2</li> <li>3</li> </ul> <li>4</li> </ul> renders to: 1 2 (‘+’ or ‘-’ doesn’t matter) 3 4 1 2 3 4 Ordered markdown 1. a 2. b 3. c 4. d html <ol> <li>!</li> <li>?</li> </ol> renders to: a b c d !

item.title: Code
item.description: Inline Code markdown For example, `this is the code` in the sentence ( using `` ` ``). html <p>For example, <code>this is the code</code></p> renders to: For example, this is the code1 in the sentence ( using ` ). For example, this is the code2 Indented Code markdown line 1 of code (indent several lines of code by at least four spaces) html <pre><code>line 1 of code line 2 of code</code></pre> renders to: line 1 of code (indent several lines of code by at least four spaces) line 1 of code line 2 of code Code Fence markdown

item.title: Table
item.description: markdown | option | description | | ------- | ----------- | | a | 1 | | b | 2 | html <table> <tr> <th>a</th> <th>b</th> </tr> <tr> <td>1</td> <td>2</td> </tr> </table> renders to: opt des a 1 b 2 a b 1 2

item.title: Link
item.description: Basic Link [my github](https://github.com/surcs) my github Add a title [surc](https://github.com/surcs "emmmmm") surc Set a anchor [a anchor](#test) and ### Basic Link <a id="test"></a> a anchor

item.title: Image
item.description: Basic ![nyantocat](https://octodex.github.com/images/nyantocat.gif "hhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh") Alternative Usage ![spidertocat][id~] [id~]: https://octodex.github.com/images/spidertocat.png "spidertocat" Resize ![saketocat](https://octodex.github.com/images/saketocat.png?width=30pc&height=30pc) Add CSS Classes ![saketocat](https://octodex.github.com/images/saketocat.png?width=30pc&height=30pc&classes=shadow,border)

item.title: Notice
item.description: Note {{% notice note %}} a notice {{% /notice %}} a notice Info {{% notice info %}} a info {{% /notice %}} a info Tip {{% notice tip %}} a tip {{% /notice %}} a tip Warning {{% notice warning %}} a warning {{% /notice %}} a warning

item.title: Expand
item.description: {{% expand "A expand ?" %}} Yes! (￣▽￣)ノ {{% /expand %}} A expand ? Yes! (￣▽￣)ノ

item.title: Button
item.description: {{% button href="https://github.com/surcs" icon="fab fa-github" %}}my github{{%/* /button %}} {{% button href="https://github.com/surcs" icon="fab fa-github" icon-position="right" %}}my github{{% /button %}} my github my github
